Yonne armedde trainne, on Bethleheme's plainne,</br>O redde, redde ys their pathe,</br>The sonne arose onne the conflict of foes,</br>Ande hee shalle goe downe onne their wrathe.
O!  who shalle join in the dreadfulle line,</br>That bathe their steppes in bloode?</br>Alle shalle join in the dreadfulle line,</br>For the cause ys the cause of Godde.
Lette the infidel bands, out-numberinge the sandes,</br>Wyth their banners cloudde the skie,</br>Fearre not their host, by the Holie Ghost,</br>The enemie shalle die!

Ande the fowls that flie through the murkie skie,</br>Shalle bee gorg'd wyth the Heathen deadde;</br>Ande the Crescent shalle falle from the rampart-walle</br>Ande the Redde-Crosse shalle wave yn ytts steadde.
Thenne lift, yee brave, fearlesse, the glaive</br>Redde wyth the Curdman's bloode,</br>Ande swearre to stande for the holie lande,</br>Yourre Savior, ande yourre Godde.</br>
